description: I love eating at Green Bamboo because they have a large selection of Vietnamese dishes. I love eating their BBH on a cold SF day. And on a hot day , I prefer eating their curry chicken rice plate or pork belly rice plate. Service is great, my mom and I both enjoy eating here so much that we eventually build friendship with the owners here. Very friendly family and they make some awesome dishes ! They definitely deserve a 5 ! yay!
author: Annie Y.

description:
Hmm, food was different but good.
service was marginally less than ok, but not offensive. 

Ordered pho, but took note of their diverse menu; clay pots fried chicken and curries to name a few.

Pho broth was not the typical pho flavor, but enjoyable. It was saltier and more beef flavor. Meat was super tender.biggest surprise was the noodles: i've never seen pho with flat white noodles as the default. But again, still good.

I'd come here again, but would probably want to try out different places first.
author: Trish G.

description:
I'd say it's pretty hard to make Vietnamese food taste bad, but this place achieved the near-impossible.

Broth was very bland. I had to ask 3 times for bean sprouts/basil/lime that all other restaurants bring out with your soup. Isn't that a standard? It wasn't even crowded. It was our group of 4 and another table of 3.

My friend who doesn't eat red meat, ordered a shrimp bún dish. They brought out bún with meat and he returned it. They ended up taking out the meat and throwing the shrimp on top because he was still finding pieces of beef in his dish while eating it.

I nearly forgot to mention that they had run out of a certain type of noodle. If 80-90% of your menu requires noodles, you would think of having a ready supply at all times. Considering it was only 5pm or so, there's no excuse to have run out of noodles.

Bad food. Bad service. Bad management. Why would you even bother?
author: Grace L.

description: Great BBQ pork sandwiches!  I usually just call my order in and pick up, takes about 10 minutes (you should give them 15 minutes).  Douse your sandwich in siracha, and voila--enjoy.
author: Linda W.

description: After waiting half an hour of constantly being ignored by the waiters walking by me, they finally took my order. I was like invisible to them and i feel very irritated by the way they treat their customers.
author: Elvin Z.

description:
I wanted to try out Lanna Thai, but didn't realize they're closed from 3-5pm. It was 3:30pm so I figured I'd give Green Bamboo a try - it has a huge Grand Opening sign and I figured pho is usually a safe bet. 

The restaurant is small, but cute and clean. The pho was terrible. It was honestly the worst pho I've ever had. The noodles didn't taste like they were cooked all the way through, the meat was tough and the broth was uninteresting and salty. I also ordered a Thai iced tea. Also worst Thai iced tea I've ever had in my life. I didn't think it was possible to make bad Thai iced tea, but they managed. It didn't taste much like Thai tea even though it was orange colored, instead it tasted like straight up high fructose corn syrup - probably an overdose of the mocha mix used to make it. It was so bad I only had 2 mouthfuls, got a headache and left the rest. I can't believe I paid for this meal.
author: Catherine S.

description: The only thing I like about this restaurant would be the bun bo hue and their dessert drinks. They give out a big glass of thai ice tea and it's perfect/ well balanced sweetness.The pho is average because the broth lacks a little bit of taste but they have really good garlic noodles. I'm very picky when I'm eating pho so the best soup noodle would be the bun bo hue. Place is owned by Chinese/Vietnamese people, the cooks used to be OG elders who cook home style but chefs have changed over the past year. I only recommend to come eating here if you're hungover from last night. =)  ENJOY
author: Chris L.

description: Checked out their Bun Bo Hue. Pretty good almost as good as my moms. Ordered pho to go for my boyfriend and the broth was flavorful. Except they use flat rice noodles that you would eat with pho ga at turtle tower. Will definitely return and order pho with thin rice noodles. So glad I found a spot that's closer to home since the spot on balboa doesn't deliver anymore.
author: Connie K.

description:
I wouldn't come back again...at least not for PHO.

It took about 20 minutes for my pho to come out with a family of 4. There was only one other family of 4 dining. I just ordered pho with rare beef and beefballs. The soup was salty yet lacking any meaty flavor; it tasted like chicken bullion cubes were tossed into water. The positive was that the rare beef was pretty tender and thicker than other restaurants.

I think their rice plates are much more appetizing but when it comes to pho which is what I tend to rate Vietnamese restaurants on, this was a huge disappointment. :\
author: Stacy G.

description:
I think this place is owned by the same Vietnamese place as the 19th and Taraval location. That being said, it is no PPQ. It's an average place with average food.

I had the five spice chicken noodle soup and the five spice chicken was tasty though I have had better. The noodles in the soup aren't pho noodles, but are flat noodles. They're still tasty but it's a little disappointing. My mom had the shanghai noodles and they were average. It was a little bland and needed some sort of spice. 

This place is alright, and the prices are decent (~$7-8/person). It's kind of a "whatever" place... not really a "LET'S GO THERE BECAUSE IT'S SO AWESOME" place.
author: Christina B.

description:
Finally! They got it DOWN!

After my many adventures here as you can see from my 1 review and 2 updates. 
The service yesterday MATCHED the delicious food they have! 
Maybe my reviews got through! 

I'm looking forward to coming back!
author: Tip S.

description: I highly recommend this place. They have a lot of food variety & all of them are pretty cheap. I got shrimp curry and it was on point ! definitely coming back next time to try their pho and other dish.  Only reason why I gave this place 4 stars is because their service is not that great. The waiter left when were not even done ordering.. Pretty rude but other than that, I think it's worth it.
author: Mary U.

description:
I dont want to be too harsh, im not going to say too much. I just didnt like how the pho had no taste really. it was the first time i didnt finish a bowl of pho. im sorry. i really wished they would be good, i really wished they would. i was looking for a new local joint to be my new fave place. this wasnt it. 
but the interior looks nice! very clean!
author: Veranna N.

description:
This restaurant just had it's "grand opening" a few months ago, but it really is just replacing the Vietnamese restaurant that was there before.  The menu looks like it's still the same (with the exception of slightly higher prices)and the food tastes the same as well.  That's a good thing because it's a pretty good restaurant.  I went back for the first time last night since it reopened.  I had originally wanted to try it on Monday, but it was packed and I didn't want to wait, so I ate a block away at Wonton House.

I ordered #18 Bun Bo Hue(the Spicy Beef and Pork Noodle Soup) and my friend ordered the Lemongrass Chicken Over RIce.  We also got an order of the Chicken Cabbage Salad.  For drinks, I got a Red Bean Ice and he got a Mung Bean Ice.

First off, the portions are huge!  The chicken cabbage salad was like a mountain of cabbage and chicken.  My friend commented that he thought there was too much fish sauce, but I like it that way, so it wasn't an issue for me.  The Bun Bo Hue (which is what the restaurant used to be named) was gigantic as well and chocked full of pork and  beef slices, tendons, and pig blood.  It's my first time getting that dish, so I can't really compare it to any other restaurants, but I thought it was decent.  The broth wasn't very spicy, and the chili oil seem to collect in certain areas of the soup, but I think I prefer the flavor of pho broth over it.  The meat and noodles, however, were quite yummy.

I especially liked the red bean w/ coconut milk drink and I tried a sip of my friend's mung bean w/ coconut milk and it was equally delicious.  It is sweet, refreshing, and really coconut-ty.  Between the drink, the salad, and the noodle soup, I was stuffed and couldn't even finish my food.  That takes quite a lot of work because I can usually finish my portion, so that tells you how large our portions were.  My friend said that his lemongrass chicken was very good, but couldn't finish it either.  He ended up taking home what looked like half his plate.

The other thing that they have is set dinners.  The prices for these are really cheap, so you can bring a group of friends and eat at bargain prices.
author: Tyler C.

description:
I don't know if it's "A-OK" but just... okay. 

I swear that Grand Opening sign has been there forever, and even if it's just replacing the other Vietnamese place that was in its exact spot, it REALLY feels like the other place, down from the layout of the place to the menu. Then again, it could just be all in my mind.

I always get the vermicelli here because that's been my go-to dish since giving up beef and making it a rare occurrence. It's pretty good. You get a large amount for the price that you pay. But then again, quantity can never beat quality.

The service could be a little bit better but personally, I've never had a problem with them. The place is on the small side, but it's never been incredibly busy, except for this one time last Sunday when I was about to go with a couple of friends, but decided not to because of the crowd.

So, if you're in the neighborhood, in the mood for Vietnamese, and don't feel like walking five blocks to Irving, this place isn't that bad. It's not great, either. Personally, if I'm craving Vietnamese, I'll go to Irving. If I'm on Noriega and crave noodles, I'll go to Lanna Thai. But if they're closed, and I don't feel like a burger, I'll go to Green Bamboo.
author: Chris S.

description: The food here is really good, not exceptional but above average. The staff are nice and attentive. The mood is casual and decorative. Perfect for a quick bite.
author: Rudy S.

description:
pretty good..decent... it was a-ok as the 3 star yelp mark says so. 

i came expecting fantastic, maybe because of the automatic door and the continuous embroidered  umbrellas hanging over us. i can tell you i;ve had much better 

i took my mom out to this place. three colored drinks..good as usual! can't go wrong with grass jelly and red bean and ice. i got the five spiced chicken with garlic noodles. the chicken had a lot of fatty pieces which seemed like they gave us the bad pieces. the short ribs on sizzling platter that we got also had a lot of fatty pieces. wheres' the good meat, bros? even though it was flavorful, i feel that the quality should be a little better. garlic noodles..ehh..had much better noodles at craw station and the one on taraval and 19th.. 

i'll still give it to them that the food was sorta good. but as long as theyre giving out meat with so much fat, can't be having that.. thanks green bambooboo.
author: Jason W.

description:
This place is nearby the Bashful Bull Burger joint and I must say for Pho, this place is pricey compared to a few blocks away (Irving Street), cuz its $2-3 cheaper! It was like a ghost town when I walked in for lunch and it stayed that way while I ate. One or two locals came in, ordered and buzzed out which left me all alone. 

Food: Soup is bland. It almost tasted like a beef broth straight out of a can.. Fried Chicken..not bad but still bland. Need some pepper, garlic and lemon zest in it or something! 

Service: 2 stars. Quick and to the point. I like that.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
The garlic chicken is delicious. I would highly recommend the spring rolls too.

Service isn't too swell. The place was dead and I think the waitress came over twice the entire afternoon/evening More like a mom and pop joint so everyone there is likely family. I'm sure that some family/friends came in while we were there too, since the waitress and cooks started to socialize with them. 

It's fairly priced.
author: Pamela R.

description: I really like the variety and the quality of the food here.  The garlic noodles and the five spice chicken are delicious.  This is our go to place for Vietnamese take out.  However, please take note.  When ordering take out...be prepared to YELL.  There are 2 people there that answer the phone who very well should not.  They can barely speak English, and they always interject every aspect of your order with a HUH?!?  I can't stand it anymore and even had to have my husband go in and give them an ear full about customer service.  As my friend Anjelah Johnson would say,"RUDE!"  If you can look past that, the food is totally worth it ;-p
author: Karen C.

description: good & abundant food. cheap prices. These reviewers are obviously not Vietnamese.  C'mon you jackasses, it's an acquire taste.
author: David T.

description:
I like their "five color rice" combination plate. Not all Vietnamese restaurants have that dish, and I enjoy it whenever I can get it.  The meats tend to be slightly overcooked, but overall not bad.  

I have also tried lamb curry, which I found had a bit thicker broth and spicier too. I prefer it that way!

Cold spring rolls with pork are god too.  There are a lot of places that fill the rolls with rice noodles, but here the filings are mostly vegetables and the meat of your choice.

Sure, it's not the best place in town, but it is a decent and convenient neighborhood restaurant (although I still miss Casa Aguilar that used to be there).
author: To K.

description: Came here today, because Kevin's Noodle House was closed on Irving. Worst food I ever had, I got #13, combination beef. When I saw the pho, I was thinking, what the heck is this? Literally only ate couple bites n then gave it to my mom for her to finish. My dad knew the owner and they chatted for about 10 minutes after eating for 20 minutes. He can already tell by the look on my face that I hate this place. Worst $35 I've ever spent on. Kevin's Noodle House, anyone? Better than this place for sure.
author: Emily L.

description: very big portions! vermicelli is legit. I wanna try the spicy soup they have there. the accept credit cards over $5.00 which is uncommon for asian places. but thats goood
author: Cindy L.

description:
came here on afternoon for lunch with my homie big boy amo.

- parking was an ease.
- seating was quick and waitress was nice.
- homie got the bun bo hue
- i got the #16? cooked and raw beef.
- food came pretty quick, my bowl of pho was bland.
- soup was not tasty, really plain and not much flavor.
- slices of beef was ok ... not the cuts i like like other places offer.
- spring rolls were decent. 6 pieces for damn $5.95 for that?
- bun bo hue seemed really oily and greasy.
- i wish the food tasted better.... i liked the ownership before this more.
author: Kenny L.

description: Average food.  The service was ok.  What can you expect from Chinese and Vietnamese restaurants in the city?  The food is average.
author: John H.

description:
what a great restaurant!

cannot timagine why anyone would give it less than 5 stars..home cooking, perfect
author: Margaret L.

description: Really nice lunch spot! Cheap and tastes really fresh. Nice ladies who work here. Try the cold vermicelli noodles. I got the pork with imperial rolls. Huge and tasty!
author: Nicole C.

description: BEWARE MUST READ!!!   Omg!! I would have to stay that in my whole life........I would have to say this place had the worst Vietnamese food ever. We are a family of 6 and after spending a day at Pier 39 we wanted some hot soup.  PHO !!  It just sounded so nice.   We yelped some Vietnamese restaurants and this place had a 3.5 star rating. So we got into the restaurant and we ordered Pho and other Vietnamese food.  Unfortunately It was the worst Vietnamese food ever.   Don't ever go here for Pho or any other Vietnamese food.  Unfortunately i have to tell everyone that It was the worst.  We ordered it and tasted awful and they still wanted us to pay.  The pork chops were fatty and the chicken didn't even look like chicken.  It may have been a rat or mice.   I ordered the beef stew with bread and it was the most disgusting thing ever. We immediately told our server the quality of food and taste was terrible and the chef came out to our table yelling at us. I couldn't believe it.  The meal and the experience was awful.     For your health and your pocket book I wouldn't ever step foot in this place.   I'm not quite sure how long they've been in business or if it's under new management but the people who gave  this place good ratings.  You're either their family and friends giving them good ratings but I'm  being totally honest !!! We left and came to San Mateo to eat at cheesecake factory.  We just needed some assurance of quality of food and service.  Sorry about the negative review green bamboo but it really was terrible.  I hope you guys can find a real chef soon otherwise I'm not sure how long you're gonna stay in business.
author: John S.

description: This restaurant comes close to substituting the two other Vietnamese pho joints on Irving, but not quite on par. They have very similar dishes like the standard noodle soups, vermicelli, and rice plates. So far I've tried the butter fried chicken (personally I like the addition of the buttery flavor but I think it needs some extra kick to it like some sort of spices. A bit bland), five spice chicken with vermicelli (I prefer the five spice chicken on Irving, still good nonetheless), and spicy beef noodle soup (this was pretty good, the soup tastes different in a good way from the other local Vietnamese joints). I wouldn't mind coming back to try the other dishes though.
author: Shongi H.

description: I don't know why the price listed is "$$$", this place is pretty cheap!  This place looks like the last Bun Bo Hue place that they took over, just a different name.  But I think the bbh tastes a lot better than last time and they give a lot of stuff.  Get their coconut drink, it's fresh and great for a warm day.
author: Phuong H.

description: I know that this restaurant is replacing the one that was there previously, but from what I've heard things are pretty much the same (menu-wise). Every time I've gone in there its dead quiet, unless you get the occasional pick up or to-go orders I see. I've had pho a few other places in the city, but I genuinely do like the food here. I don't think that 6 dollars for a HUGE bowl of pho is unreasonable. In fact when it comes, I questioned if they accidentally ordered the large instead. I couldn't even fathom that. And I always have leftover (which I usually eat later the same day as the noodles start to break apart after a while.) I tried their spring rolls, and I found it to be tasty and refreshing. I loved the peanut sauce it came with. And yes, I will agree that the staff doesn't pay much attention... but I have two things that I live by when it comes to service. 1. Don't hover. I don't like the staff coming around every 5-10 minutes to check in. Just let me eat.) 2. Make sure my water is refilled. I hate having to ask for water, and I really really hate having to ask for a refill. By default, I ask for water at the beginning of my meal considering some restaurants won't give you water unless you ask. Regardless, the well done beef and raw beef pho is great. And I love that it isn't so incredibly salty (a good indicator of MSG). With all the accompaniments, I usually leave always satisfied. I will say that the little bamboo waterfall constantly going makes me have to pee all the time since its so quiet in there. But its walking distance, so thats a plus.
author: Jacklyn S.

description: I like and go here for bun bo hue. Just the right amount of spiciness and kick on those cold nights, hits the spot each time. Traditionally served with adds ons such as pork cake, tendons, and pork blood. Let them know if you want to opt out of anything, they will adjust the add ons.
author: Peachie Y.

description: There is a young lady who works here, she provides excellent and timely service and is very friendly. I went here with a couple of friends shortly after moving to the area. We were very satisfied with our food and the portion size. I got the curry tofu, it was spicy and delicious. I've ordered food to go since then and was not as pleased with it, but that could've been a fluke. All around, I would recommend this place for a reasonably priced restaurant.
author: L M.

description: I just picked up a to go order of pho tai (rare beef noodle soup)  ... the service was super fast.  A tiny bit pricier than some other places I've been too.  My only real complaint is that they don't give you any basil or cilantro with your soup, which was kind of disappointing.. I love the basil leaves in the soup.  I will definitely give it another try though as they just opened days ago.
author: Lili L.

description: I've only had takeout, so far, but the dishes I've had have been fantastic. Obviously a very talented chef is behind this restaurant. Complex  but delicate flavors and like the best of home cooking. Try the Clay Pot Coco Chicken - comfort food, yum..
author: Doug S.
